subject: history
title: Provincial Elections 1937 & World War II Developments (1937-1939)
description: Congress ministries; Resignation crisis; WWII declared without consulting India

details.result:
Congress won clear majority in 5 provinces (Madras, UP, CP, Bihar, Orissa);
largest party in 4 others (Bombay, NWFP, Assam, Bengal)
details.muslim:
Muslim League performed poorly;
won only 109 of 482 Muslim seats (22%)
details.significance:
Congress victory showed mass support;
Muslim League's weakness exposed

details.provinces: Congress formed ministries in 8 provinces (including coalition in NWFP, Assam)
details.delay:
Initially hesitated (worried about Governor's powers);
formed after assurances
details.ministers:
**CMs:**
Govind Ballabh Pant (UP),
 B.G. Kher (Bombay),
 C. Rajagopalachari (Madras), etc.
details.performance:
Worked well within limitations;
prison reforms, education, debt relief

details.allegations: Jinnah alleged 'Congress atrocities' on Muslims in Congress-ruled provinces
details.issues: Vande Mataram song, Hindu symbols, alleged discrimination

events.title: World War II - India Declared at War WITHOUT Consultation

details.declared: Viceroy Linlithgow declared India at war with Germany (Sep 3, 1939) **WITHOUT** consulting any Indian leader or legislature
details.outrage: Congress outraged: 'India dragged into war without consent'
details.demand:
**Congress demanded:**
(1) Clear British war aims
(2) Commitment to Indian independence
(3) Immediate power transfer

details.offer:
**Viceroy offered:**
(1) Dominion status (eventually)
(2) Indians in War Advisory Council
(3) Constitutional development after war
details.inadequate: No timeline, no immediate transfer, vague promises
details.congress: Congress rejected as inadequate and insulting

details.decision: Congress Working Committee directed all ministries to resign (protest against being dragged into war)
details.governors: Governor's rule imposed in all Congress provinces
details.jinnah: Jinnah celebrated 'Day of Deliverance' (Dec 22, 1939) - end of 'Congress tyranny'

assessment.congressMinistries: Performed reasonably; prison reforms, education, debt relief; but Governor's powers limited effectiveness
assessment.resignation: Strategic blunder? Lost power and goodwill; Jinnah exploited; British had free hand during war
assessment.wwiiImpact: Set stage for Quit India Movement (1942); Also strengthened Muslim League's position

examTips.dates: Elections: 1937; Ministries formed: July 1937; WWII: Sep 3, 1939; Resignations: Oct-Dec 1939; Day of Deliverance: Dec 22, 1939
examTips.critical: India declared at war WITHOUT consultation = Major grievance ‚Üí Quit India; Congress resignation = Muslim League opportunity
